properties.areaDesc: San Diego County Deserts; Coachella Valley
properties.headline: Freeze Watch issued February 2 at 1:05PM PST until February 5 at 10:00AM PST by NWS San Diego CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 20 to 30 mph with
gusts up to 55 mph expected. For the Freeze Watch, sub-
freezing temperatures as low as 28 possible.

* WHERE...Coachella Valley and San Diego County Deserts.

* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 4 PM this afternoon to
noon PST Monday. For the Freeze Watch, from Monday evening
through Tuesday morning then again Tuesday evening through
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines.
Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially
for high profile vehicles along Interstate 10. Frost and freeze
conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and
possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust could reduce visibility.
properties.instruction:
High winds could bring down power lines and tree branches. Use
caution if you must drive.

Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent
freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should
be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have
in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above-
ground pipes to protect them from freezing

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON PST MONDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
